score.title: A Nasty Piece Of Work
paragraphs: A dead body, a Cockney drug-dealer selling from the back of the kebab shop, three suitcases full of blue flake cocaine and an unexploded World War Two bomb--these are a few of the things that make for a proper East End fiasco. This Playset is for fans of films with a certain ugly, stylish sensibility.

Maybe you're just a working-class bloke looking to catch a break, and your mate from the pub knows a guy who has a sure thing. Only it's not a sure thing and then your mate's dodgy girlfriend gets involved, and then the Russians find out what you've done and it's all going to go tits-up, isn't it?

relationships.title: Work
elements: Me and this bloke I used to work with
Me and my boss from work
Me and this bloke from work
Me and this bloke who fixed our car / plumbing / electrics
Me and this bloke I bought something off of
Me and my doctor / lawyer / accountant

relationships.title: Friendship
elements: This bloke from down the pub
"We're just mates, we're not like shagging or anything."

relationships.title: Romance
elements: Don't like each other much, but can't stop shagging

relationships.title: Family
elements: Distant relatives who have never met

needs.title: To get some answers
elements: ...from the police, about an unsolved crime
...about the accident that still haunts you

needs.title: To get respect
elements: ...by showing everybody who the real boss is
...from your lover, by keeping an unfortunate promise
...from a family member, by backing their plan
...from yourself, by standing up to a bully

needs.title: To get rich
elements: ...by working a political deal in the neighborhood
...by finding a buyer for these diamonds you "found"

needs.title: To get out
elements: ...of London before the Russians find you
...of debt, through one last bold deal
...of an obligation to a powerful criminal
...of England before Scotland Yard catches up with you

Captain Comic, books and graphic novels

"You Do Not Ask What Goes On Back There"

elements: An unexploded World War Two bomb
A water pistol that looks like a real gun

objects.title: Information
elements: A conversation you shouldn't have been listening to
A contract; maybe a legally binding one

objects.title: Valuables
elements: Ten thousand pounds in 5 pence pieces
"All you need to know is: what's in here is fucking valuable."

objects.title: Extra-Legal
elements: The strongest weed you will ever smoke
Three suitcases full of blue flake cocaine
Floor plans of a Ministry of Defence establishment
"This is the most dangerous weapon you have ever laid your dirty little hands on."
